intro: Kochia rohrlachii, commonly known as the rohrlachii tumbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to thrive in dry, sandy soils. It produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to its ability to spread across open landscapes. Kochia rohrlachii is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of soil degradation in certain ecosystems.
